title.value: Towards contrast-agnostic soft segmentation of the spinal cord
title.justification: The title accurately reflects the aim and scope of the paper, which is to achieve spinal cord segmentation that is not sensitive to the contrast of MRI images.
title.quote: Towards contrast-agnostic soft segmentation of the spinal cord

extractions.description: The paper proposes a novel method for automatic soft segmentation of the spinal cord across various MRI contrasts. The method leverages a convolutional neural network (CNN) and introduces a new pipeline to generate a single, soft ground truth (GT) segmentation that averages segmentations across various MRI contrasts. By training with these soft GT masks and using a regression-based adaptive wing loss function, the model reduces the variability in cross-sectional area (CSA) across different MRI contrasts, achieving better generalization in spinal cord segmentation and improving predictions on unseen data with pathologies or different MRI parameters.

type.justification: The paper presents a novel method and evaluates its performance using various datasets and compares it with state-of-the-art methods.
type.quote: We evaluated our model against state-of-the-art methods and performed ablation studies . . . Our results show that using the soft average segmentations along with a regression loss function reduces CSA variability.

name.justification: The research primarily focuses on the application of deep learning techniques to improve spinal cord segmentation in MRI images.
name.quote: In this work, we present a deep learning-based method that produces soft segmentations of the spinal cord.

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses the problem of segmenting spinal cord images obtained through MRI, which falls under the umbrella of medical image segmentation.
name.quote: Spinal cord segmentation is clinically relevant...In this work, we present a deep learning-based method that produces soft segmentations of the spinal cord.

name.justification: The paper utilizes a UNet model to perform spinal cord segmentation.
name.quote: Using the Spine Generic Public Database of healthy participants (n = 267; contrasts = 6), we... used to train a UNet model for spinal cord segmentation.

name.justification: The paper uses nnUNet for evaluation and comparison purposes in the study.
name.quote: We used the latest version of nnUNet (i.e. nnUNetv2) with the default, self-configured parameters on a single fold for 1000 epochs using all contrasts together and soft GT segmentations binarized using a threshold of 0.5.

name.justification: The dataset was used for training and validation of the proposed model. It has multi-contrast MRI images of healthy participants.
name.quote: We used the Spine Generic Public Database2 (Multi-Subject) (Cohen-Adad et al., 2021a) consisting of 267 healthy participants scanned across multiple MRI vendors.

name.justification: The data augmentation methods used in the study are implemented in the MONAI framework.
name.quote: These augmentation methods are readily implemented in MONAI (Jorge Cardoso et al., 2022).

name.justification: PyTorch Lightning was one of the frameworks used for training the models.
name.quote: All the models were trained using the MONAI (Jorge Cardoso et al., 2022) and PyTorch Lightning frameworks on a single 48 GB NVIDIA A6000 GPU.

name.justification: The SCT was used for various preprocessing steps, including automatic segmentation, registration, and creating ground truth masks.
name.quote: To eliminate the differences in CSA within the GT across contrasts, we used a unique label averaged over all contrasts as the GT for training...for each participant and contrast, the spinal cord is segmented using SCTâ€™s sct deepseg sc to generate a binary segmentation.
